body.p:
Lexington Nov 24th 1860
Hon Beriah Magoffin
Governor of the state of Kentucky
Dear Sir
I am well acquainted with Cornealius Hendricks Esqr. he is a gentleman & law abiding citizens, and you can rely upon anything that he may state

Your petitioner Jno C. Hendricks is a clerk in our Post office. I have been intimately acquainted with him for a number of years & Know him to be a gentleman & good Law abiding Citizen. As city attorney I was compelled to prosecute him & would Say that his cases deserve your Excellency's Clemencys and that you can place implicit confidence in the statement That he will make to you

Your obedient servant
F. G. Flanagan
City attorney

To his Exellency to Hon Beriah Magoffin
Governor of the state of Kentucky
Mr Hendricks is in my employ and I hope the Gov will remit his fine

Lexington ct. Ct
Remitted
B. M.
$20. & $100 } Concealed Weapons
C Hendricks
Issd Nov 24. 1860
